channel.title: Authors on the data diary
channel.description: Recent content in Authors on the data diary

item.title: Mark Rieke
item.description:
My name is Mark Rieke and I am a senior consumer experience (CX) analyst at Memorial Hermann Health System where I use survey data to improve patient satisfaction. I love making beautiful charts, working on home improvement projects, and playing jazzy piano.

I earned my bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Tulsa in 2018. I worked with Siemens Energy for three years designing mobile gas-turbine power plants before moving into a more data-centric role. I currently use R and tidymodels to provide actionable insights from Qualtrics survey data. In my spare time, I love analyzing public political datasets. You can find my work on GitHub and my unedited stream of consciousness on Twitter.

I live in Houston, TX, with my fiance and two obnoxious yet lovable pets.

This blog is built with blogdown and Hugo, and deployed using Netlify. The content on this site is released under the MIT License.
